sewing the yarn tail through them and hiding all the ends into the hat the shape of the finished hat should look like fig 2 pom-pom to make the pom-pom wrap one strand of pink yarn around two fingers about 30 times cut yarn and carefully remove the wrapped yarn from your fingers making sure not to unravel it cut about a 10 inch piece of the pink yarn and use it to tie a knot in the middle of the wrapped yarn see fig fig 2 3 cut the edges on either side of knot and shape your pom-pom as desired making sure not to cut the 2 long strands where the knot is tied once shaped you will notice that the pom-pom splits a bit in the middle where the knot is tied use a bit of glue to stick those edges together and then sew the pom-pom to the top of the hat should look like fig 4 when completed fig 4 fig 3 © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 4 if you have a toad that wears a crown or has dragon horns or a unicorn horn you may wish to leave your clown hat as is so it will fit over any protrusions if this is not the case though i like to add a tiny bit of stuffing into the hat for firmness and to glue a round bit of thin cardboard inside the bottom to help the hat keep its round shape better i also fold up a bit of the bottom of the hat and glue it to the cardboard as this gives the bottom of the hat a neater look see fig 5 as far as attaching the clown hat to your toad or lady spinderella doll there are a few ways to go about it if your toad is decorative you can just pin the hat to its head with a couple of straight pins if you want more sturdiness than that but you also want to be able to remove the hat i would suggest tacking the hat on with thread but not knotting it just hide the thread ends inside the toad and then when you re ready to remove the hat you can just pull out the tacking thread you could also put a thin elastic on to the bottom of the hat like a party hat or i-cord some ties to fig 5 it the choice is
